p: Genome sequence comparison is essential to analyses the evolutionary relationship of viral genomes. With the swift growth of sequence and structure databanks, in silico approaches usually enforced to ascertain the functions and structures of unannotated sequences, and to explore the relationships between sequences. In this study, we retrieved seven M pro FASTA sequence of coronaviruses (1) 229E: AGW80947 (2) NL63: AGT51371 (3) OC43: ATP16753 (4) HKU1: P0C6U4 (5) MERS-CoV: AUM60013 (6) SARS-CoV: AAY88865 and (7) 2019-nCoV: YP_009725295 from NCBI Viral genome database to discover the evolutionary relationship by phylogenetic tree construction was using MEGA X tool (Felsenstein, 1985; Kumar, Stecher, etÂ al., 2018). For in silico analysis the first reported M pro sequence from china, 2019-nCoV of YP_009725295 selected as a reference sequence.
